newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sanyo Sec to move headquarters to cut costs.
newsitem.headline: Sanyo Sec to move headquarters to cut costs.

text.p: Japan's Sanyo Securities Co Ltd said on Monday that it would move its headquarters within Tokyo, effective July 22, in an attempt to cut costs.

The move from Kayabacho in Chuo ward, central Tokyo, to a neighbouring ward will enable the second-tier brokerage to gather headquarter operations into one building and reduce rent, Sanyo Securities said.
The brokerage spends about 10 million yen per month on office rent.
The brokerage said in a statement that a branch office will be set up in Kayabacho.
At present the brokerage has 70 domestic offices.

Sanyo faces financial difficulties due to problem loans held by an affiliated firm. To help bail out the ailing non-bank financial affiliate, the second-tier brokerage started a nine-year restructuring programme three years ago.
On Friday, Sanyo said that it had asked several life insurers for a delay in repayment of its subordinated debts.
The news damaged the brokerage's shares on the Tokyo bourse. On Monday, shares of Sanyo Securities ended five yen higher at 168 in Tokyo.
